intro: Diplusodon venosus, commonly known as the veined thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, veined leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hard seeds. Diplusodon venosus is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
